intro: Saccolabium quercetorum, commonly known as the white globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spherical, pale yellow to white flower heads that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Saccolabium quercetorum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
